abstract: A majority of Verizon shareholders voted for the say-on-pay proposal, the clearest sign yet of investor irritation over chief executive compensation.
snippet: A majority of Verizon shareholders voted for the say-on-pay proposal, the clearest sign yet of investor irritation over chief executive compensation.
lead_paragraph: A proposal to give Verizon Communications’ shareholders a voice in its executive pay practices passed with 50.18 percent of the vote, the company said yesterday — the clearest sign yet of investor irritation over chief executive compensation.

headline.print_headline: Investors Get Voice on Pay At Verizon
